title: Worldedit For SinglePlayer 1.7.10

replies.body: Bro, there is no world edit for single player at 1.7.10
replies.body_tagged: Bro, there is no world edit for single player at 1.7.10

replies.body:
1 - Download world edit mod for the version of minecraft that you are using.
2 - Go to your .minecraft.
3 - Find the version of minecraft that you want to use World Edit with.
4 - Double click, and copy the 2 files inside (.json and .jar).
5 - Create a new folder and name it something which you will remember (Caps matter!!).
6 - Paste the two files in there.
7 - Rename the files the same name that you named the folder.
8 - Watch the remainder of the video.
replies.body_tagged:
1 - Download world edit mod for the version of minecraft that you are using.

5 - Create a new folder and name it something which you will remember (Caps matter!!).
6 - Paste the two files in there.
7 - Rename the files the same name that you named the folder.
8 - Watch the remainder of the video.

replies.body:
Get LiteLoader
Install the client with Optifine (Link Option)
Create a mod folder and install the World Edit Wrapper 1.7.10 made by Mumfrey
Run Minecraft with LiteLoader version...
replies.body_tagged:
Get LiteLoader
Install the client with Optifine (Link Option)
Create a mod folder and install the World Edit Wrapper 1.7.10 made by Mumfrey
Run Minecraft with LiteLoader version...

replies.body:
Yeah, I just got that for 1.7.4, I think, and it worked great :3
There's basically no differences between 1.7.4 and 1.7.10 block-wise, so it doesn't really matter. Good luck!
replies.body_tagged:

replies.body:
I got it... 1. Download LiteLoader

2. Download World edit mod
3. Create a mods folder in you .minecraft files
4. Open MC make sure its on 1.7.10
5. Put the Mod in the mods folder
6. Open LiteLoader, and confirm installation
7. Run MC.... 
8. Enyoy!

replies.body:
;/
so. Download liteloader.
INSTALL liteloader.
download wordeditwrapper 1.7.10.
Open Run(windows XP) or anything to find %appdata%
open .minecraft. find the "mods" folder. Place worldeditwrapper in it.
Run launcher, run profile "Liteloader" run version liteloader.
